record_data.record_plain_text: Golden Spread Electric Cooperative, Inc.FERC FPA Electric TariffEighth Revised Rate Schedule No. 35Proposed Effective Date 2010-07-14Replacement Energy AgreementOption Code A REPLACEMENT ENERGY AGREEMENTThe parties to this Replacement Energy Agreement ("Agreement"), which is dated as of January 9, 1998, are Golden Spread Electric Cooperative, Inc. ("Golden Spread"), and Southwestern Public Service Company ("SPS"). Golden Spread and SPS may also be referred to collectively as "Parties," and individually as "Party."RECITALSGolden Spread is a member-owned wholesale electric power supplier for rural distribution cooperatives located in the Panhandle and on the South Plains of Texas and in the Panhandle of Oklahoma. SPS is an electric utility engaged in generating, purchasing, selling, transmitting, and distributing electric capacity and energy to customers in Texas, New Mexico, Oklahoma, Kansas and elsewhere. Golden Spread plans to convert its existing full requirements service arrangements with SPS to partial requirements service in accordance with the terms of other agreements. Once Golden Spread is a partial requirements customer of SPS it will utilize SPS supplied partial requirements power and energy and other Golden Spread Resources to serve its load requirements. Commencing upon conversion to partial requirements status Golden Spread will require, from time to time, Replacement Energy when Golden Spread Resources are not available. Golden Spread has requested SPS to provide Replacement Energy to Golden Spread as required and SPS is willing to provide this service under the terms of this Agreement. As part of the consideration for SPS agreeing to provide Replacement Energy to Golden Spread, SPS has requested and Golden Spread has agreed to provide Replacement Energy to SPS under the terms of this Agreement.AGREEMENTIn consideration of the benefits to be realized by the Parties, their mutual promises, the terms of the settlement of Public Utility Commission of Texas Docket No. 15100, and the consideration set forth in this Agreement, the Parties agree as set forth below.SECTION 1.DEFINITIONSThe term "Replacement Energy" shall refer to Golden Spread and SPS Standby Service and Golden Spread and SPS Maintenance Service.The term "SPS Standby Service" shall refer to the energy SPS will provide Golden Spread if Golden Spread Resources become unavailable due to an unplanned, unscheduled outage ("Unscheduled Outage").The term "Golden Spread Standby Service" shall refer to the energy Golden Spread will provide SPS if SPS experiences an Unscheduled Outage of part or all of its generation capacity.The term "SPS Maintenance Service" shall refer to the energy SPS will provide Golden Spread during routine, scheduled maintenance ("Scheduled Outage") of Golden Spread Resources. The term "Golden Spread Maintenance Service" shall refer to the energy Golden Spread will provide SPS during a Scheduled Outage of SPS's generation capacity.The term AGolden Spread Resources@ shall mean the resources identified in Appendix A, as amended from time to time.The term "subject to availability" shall refer to the ability to provide energy from capacity available to SPS or Golden Spread in excess of the energy needed to meet native system load and firm power sale requirements or to provide power to customers taking interruptible service with limited curtailment rights.The phrase "good utility practice" shall refer to any of the practices, methods, and acts engaged in or approved by a significant portion of the electric utility industry during the relevant time period, or any of the practices, methods, and acts which, in the exercise of reasonable judgment in light of the facts known at the time the decision was made, could have been expected to accomplish the desired result at a reasonable cost consistent with good business practices, reliability, safety, and expedition. Good utility practice is not intended to be limited to the optimum practice, method, or act to the exclusion of all others, but rather to be acceptable practices, methods, or acts generally accepted in the region.SECTION 2.SPS STANDBY SERVICE2.01 SPS will provide SPS Standby Service to Golden Spread upon the request of Golden Spread subject to availability as determined in SPS=s reasonable discretion. 2.02 As a condition to Subsection 2.01, Golden Spread shall take whatever action is reasonably necessary to assure that Golden Spread Resources are regularly maintained and operated in accordance with good utility practice. If an Unscheduled Outage occurs, Golden Spread shall take all reasonable actions to restore Golden Spread Resources to service as soon as reasonably possible.2.03 If an Unscheduled Outage occurs, Golden Spread will first cause the dispatch of any other available Golden Spread Resources and Golden Spread partial requirements entitlements to meet the Golden Spread load. If other Golden Spread Resources and partial requirements entitlements are not sufficient to meet the Golden Spread load, SPS, subject to availability, will supply SPS Standby Service to Golden Spread. SPS Standby Service will be supplied on an hourly basis until other arrangements are made by Golden Spread. Golden Spread will provide SPS with an estimate of the length of the outage and SPS will then provide Golden Spread with a schedule of the amount of energy it believes it can provide during all or part of the outage. If the rules of the applicable power pool or reliability council require that, notwithstanding this Replacement Energy Agreement, emergency or some other form of energy be supplied in the event of an Unscheduled Outage, Golden Spread will be responsible for the cost of such energy supplied.SECTION 3.SPS MAINTENANCE SERVICE 3.01 SPS will provide SPS Maintenance Service to Golden Spread upon the request of Golden Spread subject to availability as determined in SPS=s reasonable discretion. Golden Spread shall take whatever action is reasonably necessary to minimize the period of time Golden Spread Resources are unavailable due to Scheduled Outage.3.02 To the extent practical in accordance with good utility practice, major Scheduled Outage of Golden Spread Resources shall be scheduled to avoid high load periods. The maintenance period shall be scheduled in advance and shall be subject to approval by SPS at least 30 days prior to the beginning of the calendar month in which the scheduled outage will take place. SPS shall not unreasonably withhold its approval to the scheduling of such maintenance.3.03 SPS Maintenance Service will be available only as needed to meet native system load and firm power sales requirements or to provide power to customers taking interruptible service with limited curtailment rights, or such other transactions as agreed to by the Parties. If the rules of the applicable power pool or reliability council require that, notwithstanding this Replacement Energy Agreement, emergency or some other form of energy be supplied in the event of an Unscheduled Outage, Golden Spread will be responsible for the cost of such energy supplied.SECTION 4.GOLDEN SPREAD STANDBY SERVICE4.01 Golden Spread will provide Golden Spread Standby Service to SPS upon the request of SPS subject to availability as determined in Golden Spread=s reasonable discretion. 4.02 As a condition to Subsection 4.01, SPS shall take whatever action is reasonably necessary to assure that SPS capacity is regularly maintained and operated in accordance with good utility practice. If an Unscheduled Outage occurs, SPS shall take all reasonable actions to restore SPS capacity to service as soon as reasonably possible.4.03 If an Unscheduled Outage occurs, SPS will first cause the dispatch of any other available SPS capacity to meet the SPS load. If other SPS capacity is not sufficient to meet the SPS load, Golden Spread, subject to availability, will supply Replacement Energy to SPS. Golden Spread Replacement Energy will be supplied on an hourly basis until other arrangements are made by SPS and Golden Spread. SPS will provide Golden Spread with an estimate of the length of the outage and Golden Spread will then provide SPS with a schedule of the amount of energy it believes it can provide during all or part of the outage. SECTION 5. GOLDEN SPREAD MAINTENANCE SERVICE5.01 Golden Spread will provide Golden Spread Maintenance Service to SPS upon the request of SPS subject to availability as determined in Golden Spread=s reasonable discretion.5.02 Major Scheduled Outage for which SPS requests Golden Spread Maintenance Service shall be scheduled at a time mutually agreeable to Golden Spread and SPS.5.03 Golden Spread Maintenance Service will be available only as needed to meet native system load and firm power sales requirements or to provide power to customers taking interruptible service with limited curtailment rights, or such other transactions as agreed to by the Parties. SECTION 6. RATES6.01 Each Party shall pay for Replacement Energy at the rates and on the terms set forth in the applicable service schedule attached to this Agreement as the same may be amended by any future revised service schedule approved by any regulatory authority having jurisdiction. Replacement Energy will be cost based, priced, and provided on an hourly, daily, weekly, and monthly basis. The Parties agree to timely file this Agreement with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission so as to enable Replacement Energy service to commence when Golden Spread converts to partial requirements service.Nothing contained in this Agreement shall be construed as affecting the right of either Party to unilaterally make application to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission for a change in rates and charges, classification of service, or any provision, term, rule, regulation, condition, or contract relating to such matters under sections 205 or 206 of the Federal Power Act and the Commission's Rules and Regulations promulgated thereunder.SECTION 7.BILLING AND PAYMENT 7.01 SPS shall on or before the fifth business day of each month, prepare a statement of account showing the net accounting for Replacement Energy transactions between the Parties during the preceding month. SPS shall provide this statement of account to Golden Spread electronically. The net amount owed by either Party to the other shall be due ten days following transmittal of the statement of account and such payment shall be made by wire transfer to the account designated by Party that is owed. If payment is not received within 15 days of the date of transmittal of the invoice, then a 1% late payment charge will be added. An additional 1% late payment charge will be added to any prior invoices not paid by the current invoice=s transmittal date. If a portion of an invoice is in dispute, the undisputed portion shall be paid by its due date. After the dispute is resolved, if either Party is found to owe all or a portion of the disputed amount, it shall promptly pay the other Party the amount found owing, plus interest at the prime rate announced by Nations Bank, of Dallas, Texas, as of the last business day of the month in which the invoice was originally due. If Nations Bank (or any substitute index bank) no longer announces a prime rate or ceases to exist, SPS may designate a new index bank by notifying Golden Spread of the selection, and the designation shall be effective as of the date the notice is delivered. A substitute index bank must be a national banking association that has capital and undivided profits of at least $100,000,000 and is located in a metropolitan area of the United States of America that has a population greater than 500,000. All statements, invoices and payments shall be subject to error correction for two years after rendition.Statements of account or payments to Golden Spread should be addressed as follows:Golden Spread Electric Cooperative, Inc.P.O. Box 9898Amarillo, Texas 79105Statements of account or payments to SPS should be addressed as follows:Southwestern Public Service CompanyAttention: Cash ManagementP.O. Box 1261Amarillo, Texas 79170 SECTION 8.TERM8.01 This Agreement shall extend for a term of 25 years from the date Golden Spread converts to partial requirements service and shall continue in force thereafter until canceled upon one year's prior written notice by either Party to the other Party. The term of this Agreement shall commence as of the date of execution, but shall be subject to the approval and authorization by any commission or regulatory body whose approval or authorization is required by law.8.02 Termination of this Agreement shall be in accordance with the rules and regulations of any Commission or regulatory body having jurisdiction over this Agreement.SECTION 9.GENERALNeither Party to this Agreement shall be obligated to plan for, construct, or acquire resources to provide service under this Agreement. If service is provided under this Agreement with resources secured from a third party, the Party receiving Replacement Energy shall be responsible to the third party for all cost associated with the service provided.Whether or not a member of the Southwest Power Pool, the Parties agree to comply with all Southwest Power Pool and North American Electric Reliability Council (or successor organization(s)) operating criteria, guidelines, and requirements for interconnected operations. In accordance with the terms of the settlement of PUCT Docket No. 14980, Golden Spread shall continue to have the right to purchase cost-based replacement energy from SPS for future resources owned or purchased by Golden Spread as provided in that settlement.GOLDEN SPREAD ELECTRIC COOPERATIVE, INC.By:_____________________________Printed Name:_____________________Title: ____________________________SOUTHWESTERN PUBLIC SERVICE COMPANYBy:_____________________________Printed Name:_____________________Title: ____________________________ Appendix AGolden Spread ResourcesResource #1 Mustang Station Units 1, 2, and 3DescriptionA 489 MW combined cycle generating station located near Denver City, Texas.Golden Spread RightsPurchase power entitlements from Mustang Station co-owners, GS Electric Generating Cooperative, Inc. and Denver City Energy Associates, L.P.Resource #2 Mustang Station Units 4 and 5Description Two 150 MW simple cycle generating units located near Denver City, Texas.Golden Spread Rights Purchase power entitlements from Yoakum Electric Generating Cooperative, Inc.A-1 Resource #3 Ranger Units 1-4Description Four 1.25 MW Deutz diesel generating units currently located in Wheeler County on the Greenbelt Electric Cooperative, Inc. system, but subject to relocation.Golden Spread Rights The Ranger Units are owned by Golden Spread.Resource #4 Reese Unit 1Description One 1.3 MW diesel generating unit currently located near the Golden Spread SP-Reese delivery point on the South Plains Electric Cooperative, Inc. system.Golden Spread Rights The Reese Unit 1 is owned by Golden Spread.A-2 REPLACEMENT ENERGY SERVICE RATE SPS SERVICE FOR GOLDEN SPREADSECTION 1 - RATES FOR REPLACEMENT ENERGY SERVICEReplacement energy purchased by Golden Spread under this Agreement shall be at the following rates at the high side of the generator step-up transformer:A. VARIABLE COST: Golden Spread shall pay Southwestern for all energy under this schedule at a rate equal to the actual increment cost incurred during period for which sale is made in mills/kWh. B. FIXED COST: Golden Spread shall pay Southwestern for all Replacement Energy under this schedule at the following rates per kW:Annual $51.46 per kWMonthly $4.29 per kWWeekly $0.99 per kWDaily $0.17 per kWHourly $0.0105 per kWThe hourly rate shall apply for all Replacement Energy unless otherwise scheduled by Golden Spread. Invoices hereunder will be increased by an amount equal to the sum of the taxes payable under federal, state and local sales tax acts, and all of the additional taxes, fees or charges (exclusive of ad valorem, state and federal income taxes) payable by SPS and levied or assessed by any governmental authority on SPS=s services rendered, or on the right or privilege of rendering the service, or on any object or event incidental to the rendition of the service, as the result of any new or amended laws after December 6, 1996. SECTION 2 - TRANSMISSION SERVICEAny transmission services required for energy sales shall be requested and procured under the terms of SPS=s then effective open access transmission tariff. SPS-1 REPLACEMENT ENERGY SERVICE RATEGOLDEN SPREAD SERVICE FOR SPSSECTION 1 - RATES FOR REPLACEMENT ENERGY SERVICEReplacement Energy purchased by SPS under this Agreement shall be at the following rates at the high side of the generator step-up transformer:A. VARIABLE COST: SPS shall pay Golden Spread for all Replacement Energy from all resources under this schedule at a rate equal to the actual incremental cost incurred during the period for which the sale is made in mills/kWh. B. FIXED COST: SPS shall pay Golden Spread for all Replacement Energy from all resources under this schedule at a system capacity rate based on the weighted average cost per kW of the projected capacity and fixed O&M rates applicable to Golden Spread’s power purchase agreements with GS Electric Generating Cooperative, Inc., Denver City Energy Associates, L.P., and Yoakum Electric Generating Cooperative, Inc.The Fixed Cost for calendar year 2009 will be:Annual $81.5392 per kWMonthly $6.7949 per kWWeekly $1.5681 per kWDaily $0.2613 per kWHourly $0.0163 per kWThe Fixed Cost will change each calendar year consistent with the formula set out above. Golden Spread shall submit an annual informational filing reflecting the updated Fixed Cost.GS-1 RESERVE SHARING: If any Resource supplying Replacement Energy experiences a partial or complete outage and a reserve sharing activation is engaged on behalf of Golden Spread, SPS will assume the costs associated with the reserve activation for the period of the activation for the amount of energy it is scheduling and purchasing during that period pursuant to this Agreement.EIS MARKET CHARGES: Replacement Energy sales pursuant to this schedule shall become effective as of the time and for the duration agreed by SPS and Golden Spread. SPS will be responsible for both the fixed costs and the incremental energy cost consistent with the agreed term of the transaction. SPS will be responsible for implementing any required transmission tags. To the extent that any Replacement Energy sold pursuant to this schedule clears through the EIS Market due to time differences in the commencement of the sale and the implementation of the tag, the inability to implement a tag due to the failure of the OATI system, the curtailment of a tag by the Transmission Provider, or a forced outage of the Resource(s) providing the Replacement Energy, the settlement of the Replacement Energy charges shall take into account the economic effect of Replacement Energy clearing through the EIS Market such that Golden Spread recovers all of its incremental costs of supplying the Replacement Energy. For example, the cost to SPS shall be the incremental cost of generated Replacement Energy less the incremental cost or credit of energy that clears thought the EIS Market. The fixed cost component of this rate schedule shall apply whether or not energy is tagged to SPS.Invoices hereunder will be increased by an amount equal to the sum of the taxes payable under federal, state and local sales tax acts, and all of the additional taxes, fees or charges (exclusive of ad valorem, state and federal income taxes) payable by Golden Spread and levied or assessed by any governmental authority on Golden Spread’s services rendered, or on the right or privilege of rendering the service, or on any object or event incidental to the rendition of the service, as the result of any new or amended laws after December 6, 1996.GS-2GS-2

Golden Spread Electric Cooperative, Inc. FERC FPA Electric Tariff Ninth Revised Rate Schedule No. 35 Proposed Effective Date 2010-07-16 Replacement Energy Agreement Option Code A REPLACEMENT ENERGY AGREEMENT The parties to this Replacement Energy Agreement ("Agreement"), which is dated as of January 9, 1998, are Golden Spread Electric Cooperative, Inc. ("Golden Spread"), and Southwestern Public Service Company ("SPS"). Golden Spread and SPS may also be referred to collectively as "Parties," and individually as "Party." RECITALS Golden Spread is a member-owned wholesale electric power supplier for rural distribution cooperatives located in the Panhandle and on the South Plains of Texas and in the Panhandle of Oklahoma. SPS is an electric utility engaged in generating, purchasing, selling, transmitting, and distributing electric capacity and energy to customers in Texas, New Mexico, Oklahoma, Kansas and elsewhere. Golden Spread plans to convert its existing full requirements service arrangements with SPS to partial requirements service in accordance with the terms of other agreements. Once Golden Spread is a partial requirements customer of SPS it will utilize SPS supplied partial requirements power and energy and other Golden Spread Resources to serve its load requirements. Commencing upon conversion to partial requirements status Golden Spread will require, from time to time, Replacement Energy when Golden Spread Resources are not available. Golden Spread has requested SPS to provide Replacement Energy to Golden Spread as required and SPS is willing to provide this service under the terms of this Agreement. As part of the consideration for SPS agreeing to provide Replacement Energy to Golden Spread, SPS has requested and Golden Spread has agreed to provide Replacement Energy to SPS under the terms of this Agreement. AGREEMENT In consideration of the benefits to be realized by the Parties, their mutual promises, the terms of the settlement of Public Utility Commission of Texas Docket No. 15100, and the consideration set forth in this Agreement, the Parties agree as set forth below. SECTION 1. DEFINITIONS The term "Replacement Energy" shall refer to Golden Spread and SPS Standby Service and Golden Spread and SPS Maintenance Service. The term "SPS Standby Service" shall refer to the energy SPS will provide Golden Spread if Golden Spread Resources become unavailable due to an unplanned, unscheduled outage ("Unscheduled Outage"). The term "Golden Spread Standby Service" shall refer to the energy Golden Spread will provide SPS if SPS experiences an Unscheduled Outage of part or all of its generation capacity. The term "SPS Maintenance Service" shall refer to the energy SPS will provide Golden Spread during routine, scheduled maintenance ("Scheduled Outage") of Golden Spread Resources. The term "Golden Spread Maintenance Service" shall refer to the energy Golden Spread will provide SPS during a Scheduled Outage of SPS's generation capacity. The term AGolden Spread Resources@ shall mean the resources identified in Appendix A, as amended from time to time. The term "subject to availability" shall refer to the ability to provide energy from capacity available to SPS or Golden Spread in excess of the energy needed to meet native system load and firm power sale requirements or to provide power to customers taking interruptible service with limited curtailment rights. The phrase "good utility practice" shall refer to any of the practices, methods, and acts engaged in or approved by a significant portion of the electric utility industry during the relevant time period, or any of the practices, methods, and acts which, in the exercise of reasonable judgment in light of the facts known at the time the decision was made, could have been expected to accomplish the desired result at a reasonable cost consistent with good business practices, reliability, safety, and expedition. Good utility practice is not intended to be limited to the optimum practice, method, or act to the exclusion of all others, but rather to be acceptable practices, methods, or acts generally accepted in the region. SECTION 2. SPS STANDBY SERVICE 2.01 SPS will provide SPS Standby Service to Golden Spread upon the request of Golden Spread subject to availability as determined in SPS=s reasonable discretion. 2.02 As a condition to Subsection 2.01, Golden Spread shall take whatever action is reasonably necessary to assure that Golden Spread Resources are regularly maintained and operated in accordance with good utility practice. If an Unscheduled Outage occurs, Golden Spread shall take all reasonable actions to restore Golden Spread Resources to service as soon as reasonably possible. 2.03 If an Unscheduled Outage occurs, Golden Spread will first cause the dispatch of any other available Golden Spread Resources and Golden Spread partial requirements entitlements to meet the Golden Spread load. If other Golden Spread Resources and partial requirements entitlements are not sufficient to meet the Golden Spread load, SPS, subject to availability, will supply SPS Standby Service to Golden Spread. SPS Standby Service will be supplied on an hourly basis until other arrangements are made by Golden Spread. Golden Spread will provide SPS with an estimate of the length of the outage and SPS will then provide Golden Spread with a schedule of the amount of energy it believes it can provide during all or part of the outage. If the rules of the applicable power pool or reliability council require that, notwithstanding this Replacement Energy Agreement, emergency or some other form of energy be supplied in the event of an Unscheduled Outage, Golden Spread will be responsible for the cost of such energy supplied. SECTION 3. SPS MAINTENANCE SERVICE 3.01 SPS will provide SPS Maintenance Service to Golden Spread upon the request of Golden Spread subject to availability as determined in SPS=s reasonable discretion. Golden Spread shall take whatever action is reasonably necessary to minimize the period of time Golden Spread Resources are unavailable due to Scheduled Outage. 3.02 To the extent practical in accordance with good utility practice, major Scheduled Outage of Golden Spread Resources shall be scheduled to avoid high load periods. The maintenance period shall be scheduled in advance and shall be subject to approval by SPS at least 30 days prior to the beginning of the calendar month in which the scheduled outage will take place. SPS shall not unreasonably withhold its approval to the scheduling of such maintenance. 3.03 SPS Maintenance Service will be available only as needed to meet native system load and firm power sales requirements or to provide power to customers taking interruptible service with limited curtailment rights, or such other transactions as agreed to by the Parties. If the rules of the applicable power pool or reliability council require that, notwithstanding this Replacement Energy Agreement, emergency or some other form of energy be supplied in the event of an Unscheduled Outage, Golden Spread will be responsible for the cost of such energy supplied. SECTION 4. GOLDEN SPREAD STANDBY SERVICE 4.01 Golden Spread will provide Golden Spread Standby Service to SPS upon the request of SPS subject to availability as determined in Golden Spread=s reasonable discretion. 4.02 As a condition to Subsection 4.01, SPS shall take whatever action is reasonably necessary to assure that SPS capacity is regularly maintained and operated in accordance with good utility practice. If an Unscheduled Outage occurs, SPS shall take all reasonable actions to restore SPS capacity to service as soon as reasonably possible. 4.03 If an Unscheduled Outage occurs, SPS will first cause the dispatch of any other available SPS capacity to meet the SPS load. If other SPS capacity is not sufficient to meet the SPS load, Golden Spread, subject to availability, will supply Replacement Energy to SPS. Golden Spread Replacement Energy will be supplied on an hourly basis until other arrangements are made by SPS and Golden Spread. SPS will provide Golden Spread with an estimate of the length of the outage and Golden Spread will then provide SPS with a schedule of the amount of energy it believes it can provide during all or part of the outage. SECTION 5. GOLDEN SPREAD MAINTENANCE SERVICE 5.01 Golden Spread will provide Golden Spread Maintenance Service to SPS upon the request of SPS subject to availability as determined in Golden Spread=s reasonable discretion. 5.02 Major Scheduled Outage for which SPS requests Golden Spread Maintenance Service shall be scheduled at a time mutually agreeable to Golden Spread and SPS. 5.03 Golden Spread Maintenance Service will be available only as needed to meet native system load and firm power sales requirements or to provide power to customers taking interruptible service with limited curtailment rights, or such other transactions as agreed to by the Parties. SECTION 6. RATES 6.01 Each Party shall pay for Replacement Energy at the rates and on the terms set forth in the applicable service schedule attached to this Agreement as the same may be amended by any future revised service schedule approved by any regulatory authority having jurisdiction. Replacement Energy will be cost based, priced, and provided on an hourly, daily, weekly, and monthly basis. The Parties agree to timely file this Agreement with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission so as to enable Replacement Energy service to commence when Golden Spread converts to partial requirements service. Nothing contained in this Agreement shall be construed as affecting the right of either Party to unilaterally make application to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission for a change in rates and charges, classification of service, or any provision, term, rule, regulation, condition, or contract relating to such matters under sections 205 or 206 of the Federal Power Act and the Commission's Rules and Regulations promulgated thereunder. SECTION 7. BILLING AND PAYMENT 7.01 SPS shall on or before the fifth business day of each month, prepare a statement of account showing the net accounting for Replacement Energy transactions between the Parties during the preceding month. SPS shall provide this statement of account to Golden Spread electronically. The net amount owed by either Party to the other shall be due ten days following transmittal of the statement of account and such payment shall be made by wire transfer to the account designated by Party that is owed. If payment is not received within 15 days of the date of transmittal of the invoice, then a 1% late payment charge will be added. An additional 1% late payment charge will be added to any prior invoices not paid by the current invoice=s transmittal date. If a portion of an invoice is in dispute, the undisputed portion shall be paid by its due date. After the dispute is resolved, if either Party is found to owe all or a portion of the disputed amount, it shall promptly pay the other Party the amount found owing, plus interest at the prime rate announced by Nations Bank, of Dallas, Texas, as of the last business day of the month in which the invoice was originally due. If Nations Bank (or any substitute index bank) no longer announces a prime rate or ceases to exist, SPS may designate a new index bank by notifying Golden Spread of the selection, and the designation shall be effective as of the date the notice is delivered. A substitute index bank must be a national banking association that has capital and undivided profits of at least $100,000,000 and is located in a metropolitan area of the United States of America that has a population greater than 500,000. All statements, invoices and payments shall be subject to error correction for two years after rendition. Statements of account or payments to Golden Spread should be addressed as follows: Golden Spread Electric Cooperative, Inc. P.O. Box 9898 Amarillo, Texas 79105 Statements of account or payments to SPS should be addressed as follows: Southwestern Public Service Company Attention: Cash Management P.O. Box 1261 Amarillo, Texas 79170 SECTION 8. TERM 8.01 This Agreement shall extend for a term of 25 years from the date Golden Spread converts to partial requirements service and shall continue in force thereafter until canceled upon one year's prior written notice by either Party to the other Party. The term of this Agreement shall commence as of the date of execution, but shall be subject to the approval and authorization by any commission or regulatory body whose approval or authorization is required by law. 8.02 Termination of this Agreement shall be in accordance with the rules and regulations of any Commission or regulatory body having jurisdiction over this Agreement. SECTION 9. GENERAL Neither Party to this Agreement shall be obligated to plan for, construct, or acquire resources to provide service under this Agreement. If service is provided under this Agreement with resources secured from a third party, the Party receiving Replacement Energy shall be responsible to the third party for all cost associated with the service provided. Whether or not a member of the Southwest Power Pool, the Parties agree to comply with all Southwest Power Pool and North American Electric Reliability Council (or successor organization(s)) operating criteria, guidelines, and requirements for interconnected operations. In accordance with the terms of the settlement of PUCT Docket No. 14980, Golden Spread shall continue to have the right to purchase cost-based replacement energy from SPS for future resources owned or purchased by Golden Spread as provided in that settlement. GOLDEN SPREAD ELECTRIC COOPERATIVE, INC. By:_____________________________ Printed Name:_____________________ Title: ____________________________ SOUTHWESTERN PUBLIC SERVICE COMPANY By:_____________________________ Printed Name:_____________________ Title: ____________________________ Appendix A Golden Spread Resources Resource #1 Mustang Station Units 1, 2, and 3 Description A 489 MW combined cycle generating station located near Denver City, Texas. Golden Spread Rights Purchase power entitlements from Mustang Station co-owners, GS Electric Generating Cooperative, Inc. and Denver City Energy Associates, L.P. Resource #2 Mustang Station Units 4 and 5 Description Two 150 MW simple cycle generating units located near Denver City, Texas. Golden Spread Rights Purchase power entitlements from Yoakum Electric Generating Cooperative, Inc. A-1 Resource #3 Ranger Units 1-4 Description Four 1.25 MW Deutz diesel generating units currently located in Wheeler County on the Greenbelt Electric Cooperative, Inc. system, but subject to relocation. Golden Spread Rights The Ranger Units are owned by Golden Spread. Resource #4 Reese Unit 1 Description One 1.3 MW diesel generating unit currently located near the Golden Spread SP-Reese delivery point on the South Plains Electric Cooperative, Inc. system. Golden Spread Rights The Reese Unit 1 is owned by Golden Spread. A-2 REPLACEMENT ENERGY SERVICE RATE SPS SERVICE FOR GOLDEN SPREAD SECTION 1 - RATES FOR REPLACEMENT ENERGY SERVICE Replacement energy purchased by Golden Spread under this Agreement shall be at the following rates at the high side of the generator step-up transformer: A. VARIABLE COST: Golden Spread shall pay Southwestern for all energy under this schedule at a rate equal to the actual increment cost incurred during period for which sale is made in mills/kWh. B. FIXED COST: Golden Spread shall pay Southwestern for all Replacement Energy under this schedule at the following rates per kW: Annual $51.46 per kW Monthly $4.29 per kW Weekly $0.99 per kW Daily $0.17 per kW Hourly $0.0105 per kW The hourly rate shall apply for all Replacement Energy unless otherwise scheduled by Golden Spread. Invoices hereunder will be increased by an amount equal to the sum of the taxes payable under federal, state and local sales tax acts, and all of the additional taxes, fees or charges (exclusive of ad valorem, state and federal income taxes) payable by SPS and levied or assessed by any governmental authority on SPS=s services rendered, or on the right or privilege of rendering the service, or on any object or event incidental to the rendition of the service, as the result of any new or amended laws after December 6, 1996. SECTION 2 - TRANSMISSION SERVICE Any transmission services required for energy sales shall be requested and procured under the terms of SPS=s then effective open access transmission tariff. SPS-1 REPLACEMENT ENERGY SERVICE RATE GOLDEN SPREAD SERVICE FOR SPS SECTION 1 - RATES FOR REPLACEMENT ENERGY SERVICE Replacement Energy purchased by SPS under this Agreement shall be at the following rates at the high side of the generator step-up transformer: A. VARIABLE COST: SPS shall pay Golden Spread for all Replacement Energy from all resources under this schedule at a rate equal to the actual incremental cost incurred during the period for which the sale is made in mills/kWh. B. FIXED COST: SPS shall pay Golden Spread for all Replacement Energy from all resources under this schedule at a system capacity rate based on the weighted average cost per kW of the projected capacity and fixed O&M rates applicable to Golden Spread’s power purchase agreements with GS Electric Generating Cooperative, Inc., Denver City Energy Associates, L.P., and Yoakum Electric Generating Cooperative, Inc. The Fixed Cost for calendar year 2010 will be: Annual $82.0815 per kW Monthly $6.8401 per kW Weekly $1.5785 per kW Daily $0.2631 per kW Hourly $0.0164 per kW The Fixed Cost will change each calendar year consistent with the formula set out above. Golden Spread shall submit an annual informational filing reflecting the updated Fixed Cost. GS-1 RESERVE SHARING: If any Resource supplying Replacement Energy experiences a partial or complete outage and a reserve sharing activation is engaged on behalf of Golden Spread, SPS will assume the costs associated with the reserve activation for the period of the activation for the amount of energy it is scheduling and purchasing during that period pursuant to this Agreement. EIS MARKET CHARGES: Replacement Energy sales pursuant to this schedule shall become effective as of the time and for the duration agreed by SPS and Golden Spread. SPS will be responsible for both the fixed costs and the incremental energy cost consistent with the agreed term of the transaction. SPS will be responsible for implementing any required transmission tags. To the extent that any Replacement Energy sold pursuant to this schedule clears through the EIS Market due to time differences in the commencement of the sale and the implementation of the tag, the inability to implement a tag due to the failure of the OATI system, the curtailment of a tag by the Transmission Provider, or a forced outage of the Resource(s) providing the Replacement Energy, the settlement of the Replacement Energy charges shall take into account the economic effect of Replacement Energy clearing through the EIS Market such that Golden Spread recovers all of its incremental costs of supplying the Replacement Energy. For example, the cost to SPS shall be the incremental cost of generated Replacement Energy less the incremental cost or credit of energy that clears thought the EIS Market. The fixed cost component of this rate schedule shall apply whether or not energy is tagged to SPS. Invoices hereunder will be increased by an amount equal to the sum of the taxes payable under federal, state and local sales tax acts, and all of the additional taxes, fees or charges (exclusive of ad valorem, state and federal income taxes) payable by Golden Spread and levied or assessed by any governmental authority on Golden Spread’s services rendered, or on the right or privilege of rendering the service, or on any object or event incidental to the rendition of the service, as the result of any new or amended laws after December 6, 1996. GS-2
